contents:
索贊尼辛（Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn）:

半個世紀前，當我還是一個孩子的時候，我聽過一些年長的人這樣解釋俄國遭受的巨大災難：人們忘記了神，這就是這一切發生的原因。

從那時起，我幾乎花了五十年時間研究俄國的革命史。在這一過程中，我讀了數百本著作，蒐集了數百份證人證言，努力清理這一巨變後的碎石瓦礫，完成了八卷著作。假如今天要我精簡地概括是什麼原因造成那場災難、吞噬了六千萬同胞的生命，我認為，最準確地莫過於重複那句話：人們忘記了神，這就是這一切發生的原因。


英文：

More than half a century ago, while I was still a child, I recall hearing a number of older people offer the following explanation for the great disasters that had befallen Russia: “Men have forgotten God; that’s why all this has happened.”

Since then I have spent well-nigh 50 years working on the history of our Revolution; in the process I have read hundreds of books, collected hundreds of personal testimonies, and have already contributed eight volumes of my own toward the effort of clearing away the rubble left by that upheaval. But if I were asked today to formulate as concisely as possible the main cause of the ruinous Revolution that swallowed up some 60 million of our people, I could not put it more accurately than to repeat: “Men have forgotten God; that’s why all this has happened.”
